title: Pakistan's Shiite Muslims celebrate Ashoura festival
description:
(1 Oct 2017) Thousands of Shiite Muslims across Pakistan on Sunday observed Ashoura, the holiest day on the Shiite Muslim calendar.
Ashoura is observed each year on the 10th day of Muharram, the first month of the Islamic year, to mourn the 7th century death of Imam Hussein, the grandson of Islam's Prophet Muhammad.
Authorities have stepped up security in Karachi and across the country following intelligence reports that militants could target Shiites this week.


You can license this story through AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/metadata/youtube/c2b16f96118aec43d7e958c1cc2e7d55
